comment.author: 32162360@N00
comment._content: The hole in the ground which was to become the QVB was there in this 1894 painting by Arthur Streeton "Fireman's Funeral' - www.artgallery.nsw.gov.au/work/43.1980/ [Edit - new link 29/07/12]

comment.author: 32162360@N00
comment._content: It is interesting to compare this photo with an earlier one by Henry King taken from exactly the same position (see how the Town Hall lines up with the Cathedral Tower). The building looked a lot better WITHOUT the later Centennial Hall, and the porte-cochère (added 1892, demolished 1934). www.flickr.com/photos/powerhouse_museum/2362659273/

comment.author: 35672655@N00
comment._content: great snap. george street traffic? horse blur. lol

comment.author: 51979177@N02
comment._content: I wonder whether Streeton's painting might have involved the funeral of the fireman who died whilst fighting the fire at Lawler's Emporium - nla.gov.au/nla.news-article71263718 Read about Lawler's Emporium via the links here - www.flickr.com/photos/state-records-nsw/4312110541/ [http://www.flickr.com/photos/beachcomberaustralia] in case you haven't realised...some of the Art Gallery of NSW links have changed...they must move the digitised pics around as well as the real ones!...do you want to add the new link to your comment above...

comment.author: 32162360@N00
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/51979177@N02] Thanks, I did know that, and i have changed the links as I revisit (sometimes).  I tried to get the AGNSW to permit thumbnail views to click through,  but no luck.  They were worried about copyright.

comment.author: 51979177@N02
comment._content: The Sydney Mail 30/11/1889 was something of a Centennial Hall issue...trawl back a few pages for the article - news.google.com/newspapers?id=75JRAAAAIBAJ&sjid=VJMDA...
